metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12015 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Perl through 5.26.2, the Archive::Tar module allows remote attackers to bypass a directory-traversal protection mechanism, and overwrite arbitrary files, via an archive file containing a symlink and a regular file with the same name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12015` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcgi-fast-perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
libperl5.18 - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
perl-base - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
perl-debug - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
perl-modules - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: perl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6').
